help.help_description: It's really necessary to explain the purpose of this command?

embed_reply.title: Command list | prefix: {PREFIX}
embed_reply.description:
```css
{PREFIX}help (command name)
{PREFIX}newChannelNameCounter [type] (custom channel name)
{PREFIX}topicCounter [enable/disable] (#channels/all)
{PREFIX}setTopic (#channels) [topic]
{PREFIX}removeTopic (#channel)
{PREFIX}setDigit [number] [custom number]
{PREFIX}prefix
{PREFIX}seeSettings
{PREFIX}resetSettings
{PREFIX}info
{PREFIX}donate```
 **Info:** `()` means an optional parameter while `[]` means a required one

newChannelNameCounter.help_description:
Creates a channel name counter.
Usage: ```{PREFIX}newChannelNameCounter [type] (custom name)```
The first argument must be one of the following listed below, the second one is optional, and it is used to set a custom channel name, when you use the second argument, remember to write `{COUNT}` wherever you want to place the counter.

Available types:
-`members`
-`users` (this excludes bots)
-`bots`
-`channels`
-`roles`
-`onlineusers` (includes bots)
-`offlineusers` (includes bots)
-`connectedusers` This one counts how many users are connected in all the voice channels in this server

Counter that counts members:```{PREFIX}newChannelNameCounter members```
 With a custom name:```{PREFIX}newChannelNameCounter members Members: {COUNT}```
newChannelNameCounter.no_perms: I need `Manage Channels` permission to create the channel.

topicCounter.help_description:
Usage:```css
{PREFIX}topicCounter [enable/disable] (#channels/all)```
This command displays a real time member counter in a channel topic

Examples:
```css
{PREFIX}topicCounter enable
{PREFIX}topicCounter enable #general
{PREFIX}topicCounter enable #general #other-channel
{PREFIX}topicCounter disable all```
**!**  If you don't mention any channel like in the first example, the counter will be enabled/disabled in the current channel
 **!**  When you mention a channel it must match exactly its name, and you must use `#`
topicCounter.success_enable: The counter has been enabled on {CHANNELS}
topicCounter.success_disable: The counter has been disabled on {CHANNELS}

setDigit.help_description:
Customizes numbers that will be displayed, the number argument must be a normal number, the second argument could be anything, like an emoji or a normal number with markdown

Usage: ```{PREFIX}setDigit [number] [your custom number]```
Example: ```{PREFIX}setDigit 3 **3**```
With the previous example every 3 will be shown as a bold **3**

setTopic.help_description:
You can customize the topic with this command, remember to write `{COUNT}` wherever you want to place the counter. You can also set a unique topic for different channels

If the first argument are channel mentions, the topic given will be only used in the mentioned channels, (remember to mention the channels with ``#``).

 Examples:

This will set the topic for those channels without a specific topic defined```{PREFIX}setTopic Current members: {COUNT}```
This will display the given topic only in the first mentioned channels```{PREFIX}setTopic #general Current members: {COUNT}
{PREFIX}setTopic #general #other-channel Current members: {COUNT}```
setTopic.success: Topic customized for all channels without a custom one.
setTopic.success_unique: Topic customized for the following channels: {CHANNELS}
setTopic.no_topic: No topic were provided, more info: `{PREFIX}help setTopic`.

removeTopic.help_description:
This command removes channel topics that has been customized, here is a list of examples:

Removes the customized topic for channels without specific topic:```{PREFIX}removeTopic```
Remove specific topics that has been established by mentioning channels```{PREFIX}removeTopic #general #other-channel```
removeTopic.success_unique: Unique topic removed for the following channels: {CHANNELS}
removeTopic.error_missing_params: Error: Missing parameters, more info: `{PREFIX}help removeTopic`.

prefix.help_description:
Changes the bot prefix.

Usage:```{PREFIX}prefix [new prefix]```

seeSettings.help_description: Shows all bot settings for this server.

settings_message.main_topic_text: Main topic for channels with a topic counter (used of those wihtout a custom one):

resetSettings.help_description: Restores the custom settings of this server to the default ones

update.help_description: If you think the counter is stuck use this command to force its update
update.success: Updating the counter for enabled channels, this may take a while.

lang.help_description: Changes the bot language for this guild, you must have administrator permissions to run this command.
lang.error_not_found: I didn't find that language, try one of the following:

updateCounter.error_no_perms: Looks like I don't have permissions to set the topic of this channel. Please, give me the proper permissions or disable me using ``{PREFIX}disableTopicCounter``.
